name: apple-tracker
dataPortalHtml:
In iOS 15.2, iPadOS 15.2, and watchOS 8.3 or later, users can view a privacy report of when your apps accesses certain kinds of user data, like photos and contacts or sensitive device resources, like the camera and microphone. You can also see when they contacts network domains, including websites that you visit from within your apps. Examine the data that your apps contributes to this summary to make sure that your app behaves as you expect. Once you receive it, analyze it here.
  • Go to the Settings app then choose Privacy > App Privacy Report.
  • Enable app activity recording on your device by tapping Turn On App Privacy Report
  • Run your apps for a while
  • Download the report by tapping the Share button on the App Privacy Report screen
  • Drop the downloaded file below
subtitle: Tracking data
title: AppleTracker

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  NetworkActivityIOS;
viewBlocks.title: Network Activity
viewBlocks.text: Explore every connection made by your applications to a particular domain. The result is limited to the last two weeks since you activated the App Privacy Report.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  ResourceAccessIOS
GROUP BY
  identifier;
viewBlocks.title: Resource Access
viewBlocks.text: Explore every access your apps have made to a resource on your device. The result is limited to the last two weeks since you activated the App Privacy Report.

title: Facebook

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  name AS advertiserName,
  o.timestamp AS date_,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  OffFacebookActivityEvent o
GROUP BY
  name,
  o.timestamp;
viewBlocks.title: Off Facebook activity ranking
viewBlocks.text: See how many times third parties have informed Facebook of your activity outside of Facebook.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  name AS targetingType,
  type AS targetingValue,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  OffFacebookActivityEvent
WHERE
  targetingType IN (
    SELECT
      name
    FROM
      OffFacebookActivityEvent
    GROUP BY
      name
    ORDER BY
      COUNT(*) DESC
    LIMIT
      10
  )
GROUP BY
  targetingType,
  targetingValue
viewBlocks.title: Off Facebook activity type
viewBlocks.text: See which kind of information advertisers have shared with Facebook of your activity outside of Facebook.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  title,
  a.action,
  a.timestamp
FROM
  AdvertiserInteraction a
GROUP BY
  title,
  a.timestamp;
viewBlocks.title: Ad interactions
viewBlocks.text: See the list of ads with which you have interacted.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  name
FROM
  AdsInterest
viewBlocks.title: Inferred interests
viewBlocks.text: Get a list of topics that Facebook thinks you're interested in.

viewBlocks.sql:

  *
FROM
  AdvertiserUploadedContactInformation;
viewBlocks.title: Contact list

FROM

title: Google Takeout

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  PlaceVisit;
viewBlocks.title: Places visited
viewBlocks.text: This map shows what places Google think you visited with the size corresponding to the time you spent in this place:

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  winnerLatitude,
  winnerLongitude,
  winnerAddress,
  winnerName,
  winnerConfidence,
  winnerSemanticType,
  loserLatitude,
  loserLongitude,
  loserAddress,
  loserName,
  loserConfidence,
  loserSemanticType,
  startTimestamp,
  endTimestamp
FROM
  Winners
  INNER JOIN Losers ON Winners.id = Losers.loserId
viewBlocks.title: One Place

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  winnerLatitude,
  winnerLongitude,
  winnerAddress,
  winnerName,
  winnerConfidence,
  winnerSemanticType,
  loserLatitude,
  loserLongitude,
  loserAddress,
  loserName,
  loserConfidence,
  loserSemanticType,
  startTimestamp,
  endTimestamp
FROM
  Winners
  INNER JOIN Losers ON Winners.id = Losers.loserId
viewBlocks.title: Other Candidates
viewBlocks.text: This map shows the other candidate places proposed by Google linked to the location that Google think you visited:

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  ActivitySegment;
viewBlocks.title: Travels
viewBlocks.text: This map shows what trips Google think you did:

viewBlocks.sql:
WITH
  a AS (
    SELECT
      *
    FROM
      Records
    ORDER BY
      Records.timestamp DESC
    LIMIT
      100000
  )
SELECT
  a.latitude,
  a.longitude,
  a.timestamp,
  a.accuracy,
  a.source,
  ActivitySegment.activityType
FROM
  a,
  ActivitySegment
WHERE
  a.timestamp >= startTimestamp
  AND a.timestamp <= endTimestamp
viewBlocks.title: Records
viewBlocks.text: This map shows records associated to a trip with the color corresponding to an activity type:

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  mac,
  AVG(latitude) AS latitude,
  AVG(longitude) AS longitude,
  COUNT(*) AS number_of_detections
FROM
  WifiScan
  INNER JOIN MacAdresses ON WifiScan.id = MacAdresses.macId
GROUP BY
  mac
ORDER BY
  COUNT() DESC
viewBlocks.title: Wifi
viewBlocks.text: This map shows where your phone detected mac addresses with the size corresponding to the number of times it was detected:

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  HerProfile;
viewBlocks.title: User Infos
viewBlocks.text: HER profile information

viewBlocks.sql:
WITH
  TempLike AS (
    SELECT
      SUBSTR(likedAt, 1, 10) AS likedAt
    FROM
      HerLike
  ),
  TempSkip AS (
    SELECT
      SUBSTR(skippedAt, 1, 10) AS skippedAt
    FROM
      HerSkip
  )
SELECT
  likedAt AS date_,
  "Like" AS actionValue,
  COUNT(*) AS actionCount
FROM
  TempLike
GROUP BY
  likedAt
UNION
SELECT
  skippedAt AS date_,
  "Skip" AS actionValue,
  COUNT(*) AS actionCount
FROM
  TempSkip
GROUP BY
  skippedAt;
viewBlocks.title: Likes and Passes
viewBlocks.text: Number of likes and passes that you made over time.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  HerNotification;
viewBlocks.title: Notifications
viewBlocks.text: Number of notifications that you recieved over time.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  HerLike;
viewBlocks.title: Matches
viewBlocks.text: Look at the likes you've made that have become matches or not.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  HerMessage;
viewBlocks.title: Messages
viewBlocks.text: Message Activity

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  HerBlock;
viewBlocks.title: Blocks
viewBlocks.text: Blocks that you established over time.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  HerReport;
viewBlocks.title: Reported
viewBlocks.text: Users that you reported to the moderation.

title: Instagram

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  accountName,
  datetime AS actionDate,
  'Post Viewed' AS actionType
FROM
  InstagramPostViewed
UNION
SELECT
  accountName,
  datetime AS actionDate,
  'Video Watched' AS actionType
FROM
  InstagramVideoWatched
UNION
SELECT
  accountName,
  datetime AS actionDate,
  'Ad Viewed' AS actionType
FROM
  InstagramAdViewed;
viewBlocks.title: Consumption
viewBlocks.text: See how much content you watch over time.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT *
FROM (
  SELECT
    accountName,
    datetime AS _date,
    'Post Viewed' AS actionType
  FROM
    InstagramPostViewed
  UNION
  SELECT
    accountName,
    datetime AS _date,
    'Video Watched' AS actionType
  FROM
    InstagramVideoWatched
  UNION
  SELECT
    accountName,
    datetime AS _date,
    'Ad Viewed' AS actionType
  FROM
    InstagramAdViewed
  UNION
  SELECT
    accountName,
    DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS), 'unixepoch') AS _date,
    'Follow' AS actionType
  FROM
    InstagramFollowing
  UNION
  SELECT
    accountName,
    DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS _date,
    'Comment Liked' AS actionType
  FROM
    InstagramCommentLiked
  UNION
  SELECT
    accountName,
    datetime AS _date,
    'Post Liked' AS actionType
  FROM
    InstagramPostLiked
  UNION
  SELECT
    senderName as accountName,
    DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS / 1000), 'unixepoch') AS _date,
    'Message Sent' as actionType
  FROM
    InstagramMessage
  WHERE InstagramMessage.senderName IN (SELECT name as username FROM InstagramInfo)
)
ORDER BY _date ASC;
viewBlocks.title: Consommation (durée)
viewBlocks.text: See which advertisers are using your information on Instagram.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  accountName,
  DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS), 'unixepoch') AS _date,
  'Follow' AS interactionType
FROM
  InstagramFollowing
UNION
SELECT
  accountName,
  DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS _date,
  'Comment Liked' AS interactionType
FROM
  InstagramCommentLiked
UNION
SELECT
  accountName,
  datetime AS _date,
  'Post Liked' AS interactionType
FROM
  InstagramPostLiked
UNION
SELECT
  senderName as accountName,
  DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS / 1000), 'unixepoch') AS _date,
  'Message Sent' as interactionType
FROM
  InstagramMessage
WHERE InstagramMessage.senderName IN (SELECT name as username FROM InstagramInfo)
UNION
SELECT
  senderName as accountName,
  DATETIME(ROUND(timestampMS / 1000), 'unixepoch') AS _date,
  'Message Received' as interactionType
FROM
  InstagramMessage
WHERE InstagramMessage.senderName NOT IN (SELECT name as username FROM InstagramInfo);
viewBlocks.title: Interactions
viewBlocks.text: See which actions you do most when using Instagram.

viewBlocks.title: Ad 1/3 (Interactions)
viewBlocks.text: See how much ads you see and wether or not you interact with them.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT title, 'Ad Interest' as _type FROM InstagramAdInterest
UNION
SELECT title, 'Topic' as _type FROM InstagramYourTopic
UNION
SELECT title, 'Reel Topic' as _type FROM InstagramReelTopic
UNION
SELECT title, 'Reel Sentiment' as _type FROM InstagramReelSentiment;
viewBlocks.title: Ad 2/3 (Interests)
viewBlocks.text: See which interests are inferred about you.

viewBlocks.sql: SELECT * FROM InstagramAdvertiser;
viewBlocks.title: Ad 3/3 (Advertisers)
viewBlocks.text: See which advertisers are using your information on Instagram.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  title,
  DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS _date,
  latitude,
  longitude,
  'Post' AS actionType
FROM InstagramPost
WHERE latitude IS NOT NULL AND longitude IS NOT NULL
UNION
SELECT
  title,
  DATETIME(unixTimestamp, 'unixepoch') AS _date,
  latitude,
  longitude,
  'Story' AS actionType
FROM InstagramStory
WHERE latitude IS NOT NULL AND longitude IS NOT NULL;

inference.title: Inferences about you
inference.text: Each card below represents an inference that Linkedin has made about you, either positively or negatively, e.g. Am I a joob seeker -> true or false.

ad-targeting.title: Ad targeting
ad-targeting.text: This information is used by Linkedin to determine which ads to show you. Some of the targeting data may be derived from other information you have provided to them. For example, they may use your title as an indication of your seniority level.

connections.title: Connections
connections.text: This tool allows you to track all the connections you have made with Linkedin, you can filter by date, day or by company and position in your address book.

title: TikTok

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  LoginHistory;
viewBlocks.title: Login History
viewBlocks.text: When and where you logged in

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  date_,
  actionType,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      SUBSTR(DATE, 0, INSTR(DATE, ' ')) AS date_,
      'Follower' AS actionType
    FROM
      TiktokFollowerList
    UNION
    SELECT
      SUBSTR(DATE, 0, INSTR(DATE, ' ')) AS date_,
      'Following' AS actionType
    FROM
      TiktokFollowingList
  )
GROUP BY
  date_,
  actionType;
viewBlocks.title: Following vs Follower
viewBlocks.text: See how much you have follow or have been followed during time

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      DATE AS date_,
      searchterm AS activityValue,
      'Search' AS activityType
    FROM
      SearchHistory
    UNION
    SELECT
      DATE AS date_,
      link AS activityValue,
      'Share' AS activityType
    FROM
      ShareHistory
    UNION
    SELECT
      DATE AS date_,
      videolink AS activityValue,
      'Like' AS activityType
    FROM
      LikeList
    UNION
    SELECT
      DATE AS date_,
      videolink AS activityValue,
      'Watch' AS activityType
    FROM
      VideoBrowsingHistory
    UNION
    SELECT
      DATE AS date_,
      username AS activityValue,
      'Block' AS activityType
    FROM
      BlockList
    UNION
    SELECT
      DATE AS date_,
      comment AS activityValue,
      'Comment' AS activityType
    FROM
      TiktokComment
  )
viewBlocks.title: Activity History
viewBlocks.text: Consult every actions you have made on the app.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  ChatHistory;
viewBlocks.title: Chat Activity
viewBlocks.text: Private messages sent and received

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  TinderUser;
viewBlocks.title: User infos
viewBlocks.text: Tinder profile information

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  dateValue,
  actionType,
  amount
FROM
  TinderUsage
WHERE
  actionType = 'app_opens';
viewBlocks.text: See the number of times that you opened the app per day.
viewBlocks.title: Usage

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  dateValue,
  actionType,
  amount
FROM
  TinderUsage
WHERE
  actionType = 'swipes_likes'
  OR actionType = 'swipes_passes'
viewBlocks.text: See the number of likes and passes that you made over time.
viewBlocks.title: Likes and passes

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  TinderMessage;
viewBlocks.title: Messages
viewBlocks.text: See at what time of the day and week you send the most messages

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  dateValue,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'swipes_likes' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) likes,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'superlikes' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) number_of_superlikes,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'swipes_passes' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) passes,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'messages_sent' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) number_of_messages_sent,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'messages_received' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) number_of_messages_received,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'matches' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) number_of_matches,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'app_opens' THEN amount
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) opens
FROM
  TinderUsage
GROUP BY
  dateValue;
viewBlocks.text: Compare the different actions you perform in the application.
viewBlocks.title: Comparison

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  dateValue,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'swipes_likes' THEN amount
      ELSE NULL
    END
  ) likes,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'swipes_passes' THEN amount
      ELSE NULL
    END
  ) passes,
  MAX(
    CASE
      WHEN actionType = 'app_opens' THEN amount
      ELSE NULL
    END
  ) opens
FROM
  TinderUsage
GROUP BY
  dateValue;
viewBlocks.text: Observe the possible correlation between the number of likes/passes and the number of times you open the app.
viewBlocks.title: Likes / passes correlation

name: tracker-control
dataPortalHtml: Install and enable TrackerControl to monitor the behaviour of the apps on your Android phone, using these install instructions. Once you have collected some data, export it (export instructions here) and analyze it here.

trackerControl.title: Overview
trackerControl.text: Monitor below all the tracking done on your smartphone applications. You can filter the results by selecting a time range, selecting certain apps in the dropdown, clicking on each graph, or using the table filters or search box.

messages.select-applications-hint: Select the applications you want to include in the visualisation

trackerControl.title: Vue d'ensemble
trackerControl.text: Surveillez ci-dessous tout le suivi effectué sur les applications de votre smartphone. Vous pouvez filtrer les résultats en sélectionnant une plage de temps, en choisissant certaines applications dans la liste déroulante, en cliquant sur chaque graphique, ou en utilisant les filtres du tableau ou le champ de recherche.

messages.select-applications-hint: Sélectionnez les applications que vous souhaitez inclure dans la visualisation.
messages.Amount of tracking over time: Quantité de suivi dans le temps
messages.Companies behind tracking: Les entreprises à l'origine du suivi

subtitle: Tracking data
title: TrackerControl

viewBlocks.title: Overview
viewBlocks.text: Monitor below all the tracking done on your smartphone applications. You can filter the results by selecting a time range, selecting certain apps in the dropdown, clicking on each graph, or using the table filters or search box.

overview.title: Advertising overview
overview.text: Understand how much, who and why you are being targeted by Twitter ads in this interactive visualization. Click on any graph to filter the results.

overview-last-month.title: Advertising overview (last month)
overview-last-month.text: Understand who targeted you with Twitter ads last month, how much, and why, in this interactive visualization. Click on any graph to filter the results.

ads-per-advertiser.title: Top advertisers
ads-per-advertiser.text: See the ranking of advertisers that have shown you the most ads.

targeting-criteria-by-advertiser.title: Targeting criteria (Top 10 advertisers)
targeting-criteria-by-advertiser.text: Understand why you have been targeted by these advertisers. The graph shows the 10 advertisers who use the most targeting criteria on you. In the first ring you will find the different advertisers, in the second ring the types of targeting used (location, language, ...). And finally, if you click on a ring, the graph will enlarge to show you the targeting values (Swiss, French, ...) in the outer ring.

targeting-criteria-all-advertisers.title: Targeting criteria (All advertisers)
targeting-criteria-all-advertisers.text: Get more details on how you are targeted by these advertisers. This graph shows the number of times you have been targeted by different advertisers using a specific criterion. You can change the type of criterion and get information about the meaning of each criterion's type at the bottom of the graph.

all-criteria-all-advertisers.title: Targeting criteria (1 advertiser)
all-criteria-all-advertisers.text: Visualize the targeting criteria used by one specific advertiser. You can look up the advertiser in the table below and click on it to visualise them.

personalization.title: Inferred Data
personalization.text: Find out what information Twitter has deduced about you

gender.title: Gender
gender.hint: Gender associated with the account. This information may be inferred.

age.title: Age
age.hint: Date of birth Twitter has inferred about the account and corresponding current age.

languages.title: Languages
languages.hint: Gender associated with the account. This information may be inferred.

numAudiences.title: Audiences
numAudiences.hint: Number of tailored audiences (audiences generated by advertisers) the account is a part of.

interests.title: Inferred Interests
interests.hint: These are some of the interests that match you, based on your profile, your activity and the topics you follow. They are used to personalise your experience on Twitter, including the ads you see.

lookalikeAdvertisers.title: Look-alike Advertisers
lookalikeAdvertisers.hint: List of screen names for the advertisers that own the look-alike audiences your account is a part of.

advertisers.title: Advertisers
advertisers.hint: Here are the advertisers who have added you to one of their audiences. Custom audiences are often created from lists of email addresses or browsing behaviour. They allow advertisers to reach potential customers or users who have already expressed interest in their business.

shows.title: Shows
shows.hint: The programmes you are likely to watch, based on your account activity and information.

locationHistory.title: Location History
locationHistory.hint: Here are the locations that Twitter has associated with your account, based on your activity from the last 60 days.

genericDateViewer.name: Timeline
genericDateViewer.title: Timeline
genericDateViewer.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.
genericDateViewer.graphTitle: Number of dated events in your files
genericDateViewer.graphNoDate: No dated events were found in your file(s).
genericDateViewer.datedEvents: From {currMinDate} to {currMaxDate} we found {total} dated events in your file(s).

overview.title: Vue d'ensemble des publicités
overview.text: Visualisation du nombre, de l'origine et des critères de ciblage des publicités Twitter qui vous visent. Cliquer sur un graphique pour filtrer les résultats.

messages.interactions: Interactions avec les pubs (clics, visionnage de vidéos)

overview-last-month.title: Vue d'ensemble des publicités (du mois dernier)
overview-last-month.text: Visualisation du nombre, de l'origine et des critères de ciblage des publicités Twitter qui vous ont visé le mois dernier. Cliquer sur un graphique pour filtrer les résultats.

messages.interactions: Interactions avec les pubs (clics, visionnage de vidéos)

ads-per-advertiser.title: Principaux publicitaires
ads-per-advertiser.text: Classement des publicitaires qui vous ont présenté le plus de publicités.

targeting-criteria-by-advertiser.title: Critères de ciblage (10 principaux publicitaires)
targeting-criteria-by-advertiser.text: Pourquoi êtes-vous ciblé par ces publicitaires? Ce graphique montre les dix publicitaires qui employent le plus de critères pour vous cibler. Le cercle intérieur affiche les publicitaires, le cercle extérieur le type de ciblage (tels que l'emplacement, la langue, etc.). Cliquer sur l'un des cercles aggrandit le graphique pour montrer les valeurs qui apparaissent dans les critères (telles que "Suisse", "France", etc.)

targeting-criteria-all-advertisers.title: Critères de ciblage (tous publicitaires)
targeting-criteria-all-advertisers.text: Vue complète des critères qui permettent aux publicitaires de vous cibler. Ce graphique montre le nombre de fois où les divers publicitaires vous ont visé sur la base d'un critère donné. Vous pouvez changer les types de critères et en savoir davantage sur eux au bas du graphique.

all-criteria-all-advertisers.title: Critères de ciblage (1 publicitaire)
all-criteria-all-advertisers.text: Visualisation des critères de ciblage qu'un publicitaire donné utilise pour vous cibler. Parcourir la liste et cliquer sur un publicitaire pour afficher ses informations.

personalization.title: Données supposées
personalization.text: Information que Twitter a déduites à votre sujet.

gender.title: Sexe
gender.hint: Sexe associé au compte. Cette information peut être déduite.

age.title: Age
age.hint: Date de naissance que Twitter a déduite du compte et âge actuel correspondant.

languages.title: Langues
languages.hint: Sexe associé au compte. Cette information peut être déduite.

numAudiences.title: Audiences
numAudiences.hint: Nombre d'audiences personnalisées (audiences générées par les publicitaires) dont le compte fait partie.

interests.title: Intérêts inférés
interests.hint: Ce sont certains des intérêts qui vous correspondent, en fonction de votre profil, de votre activité et des sujets que vous suivez. Ils sont utilisés pour personnaliser votre expérience sur Twitter, y compris les publicités que vous voyez.

lookalikeAdvertisers.title: Publicitaires sosies
lookalikeAdvertisers.hint: Liste des noms d'écran des publicitaires qui possèdent les audiences sosies dont votre compte fait partie

advertisers.title: Publicitaires
advertisers.hint: Voici les publicitaires qui vous ont ajouté à l'une de leurs audiences. Les audiences personnalisées sont souvent créées à partir de listes d'adresses e-mail ou de comportements de navigation. Elles permettent aux publicitaires d'atteindre des clients potentiels ou des utilisateurs qui ont déjà exprimé un intérêt pour leur activité.

shows.title: Spectacles
shows.hint: Les programmes que vous êtes susceptible de regarder, en fonction de l'activité et des informations de votre compte.

locationHistory.title: Historique de la localisation
locationHistory.hint: Voici les lieux que Twitter a associés à votre compte, en fonction de votre activité des 60 derniers jours.

genericDateViewer.name: Chronologie
genericDateViewer.title: Chronologie
genericDateViewer.text: Voir tous les événements datés dans vos dossiers, correspondant aux données qui ont été collectées sur vous à ou concernant une date spécifique.
genericDateViewer.graphTitle: Nombre d'événements datés dans vos dossiers
genericDateViewer.graphNoDate: Aucun événement daté n'a été trouvé dans votre (vos) dossier(s).
genericDateViewer.datedEvents: De {currMinDate} à {currMaxDate} nous avons trouvé {total} événements datés dans votre (vos) fichier(s).

viewBlocks.sql:
WITH
  EngagementCount AS (
    SELECT
      a.tweetId,
      a.advertiserName,
      a.displayLocation,
      a.time,
      COUNT(*) AS count_
    FROM
      TwitterAd a,
      TwitterEngagement e
    WHERE
      a.tweetId = e.tweetId
      AND a.advertiserName = e.advertiserName
      AND a.displayLocation = e.displayLocation -- We only consider engagements that occur
      -- within 120 sec of a corresponding impression.
      -- 60 sec x 60 min x 24 hours = 86,400 sec
      AND ABS(
        ROUND((JULIANDAY(a.time) - JULIANDAY(e.time)) * 86400)
      ) < 120
    GROUP BY
      a.tweetId,
      a.advertiserName,
      a.displayLocation,
      a.time
  ),
  Engagement AS (
    SELECT
      a.tweetId,
      a.advertiserName AS companyName,
      -- Return 0 if ad has no engagements
      IFNULL(
        (
          SELECT
            ec.count_
          FROM
            EngagementCount ec
          WHERE
            a.tweetId = ec.tweetId
            AND a.advertiserName = ec.advertiserName
            AND a.displayLocation = ec.displayLocation
            AND a.time = ec.time
        ),
        0
      ) engagements,
      a.time AS date_,
      c.targetingType,
      c.targetingValue
    FROM
      TwitterAd a
      INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion c ON a.id = c.adId
  )
SELECT
  (
    -- Yes/No is interpreted as BOOLEAN by type-check.js
    CASE
      WHEN e.engagements IS 0 THEN 'No'
      ELSE 'Yes'
    END
  ) AS engagedWith,
  e.*
FROM
  Engagement e
viewBlocks.title: Advertising overview
viewBlocks.text: Understand how much, who and why you are being targeted by Twitter ads in this interactive visualization. Click on any graph to filter the results.

viewBlocks.sql:
WITH
  EngagementCount AS (
    SELECT
      a.tweetId,
      a.advertiserName,
      a.displayLocation,
      a.time,
      COUNT(*) AS count_
    FROM
      TwitterAd a,
      TwitterEngagement e
    WHERE
      a.tweetId = e.tweetId
      AND a.advertiserName = e.advertiserName
      AND a.displayLocation = e.displayLocation -- We only consider engagements that occur
      -- within 120 sec of a corresponding impression.
      -- 60 sec x 60 min x 24 hours = 86,400 sec
      AND ABS(
        ROUND((JULIANDAY(a.time) - JULIANDAY(e.time)) * 86400)
      ) < 120
    GROUP BY
      a.tweetId,
      a.advertiserName,
      a.displayLocation,
      a.time
  ),
  Engagement AS (
    SELECT
      a.tweetId,
      a.advertiserName AS companyName,
      -- Return 0 if ad has no engagements
      IFNULL(
        (
          SELECT
            ec.count_
          FROM
            EngagementCount ec
          WHERE
            a.tweetId = ec.tweetId
            AND a.advertiserName = ec.advertiserName
            AND a.displayLocation = ec.displayLocation
            AND a.time = ec.time
        ),
        0
      ) engagements,
      a.time AS date_,
      c.targetingType,
      c.targetingValue
    FROM
      TwitterAd a
      INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion c ON a.id = c.adId
    WHERE
      a.time > DATE('now', '-1 month')
  )
SELECT
  (
    -- Yes/No is interpreted as BOOLEAN by type-check.js
    CASE
      WHEN e.engagements IS 0 THEN 'No'
      ELSE 'Yes'
    END
  ) AS engagedWith,
  e.*
FROM
  Engagement e
viewBlocks.title: Advertising overview (last month)
viewBlocks.text: Understand how much, who and why you have been targeted by Twitter ads last month in this interactive visualization. Click on any graph to filter the results.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  advertiserName,
  DATE(t.time) AS date_,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  TwitterAd t
GROUP BY
  advertiserName;
viewBlocks.title: Top advertisers
viewBlocks.text: See the ranking of advertisers that have shown you the most ads.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  advertiserName,
  targetingType,
  targetingValue,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  TwitterAd
  INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion ON TwitterAd.id = TwitterCriterion.adId
WHERE
  TwitterAd.advertiserName IN (
    SELECT
      advertiserName
    FROM
      TwitterAd
    GROUP BY
      advertiserName
    ORDER BY
      COUNT(*) DESC
    LIMIT
      10
  )
GROUP BY
  advertiserName,
  targetingType,
  targetingValue
viewBlocks.title: Targeting criteria (Top 10 advertisers)
viewBlocks.text: Understand why you have been targeted by these advertisers. The graph shows the 10 advertisers who use the most targeting criteria on you. In the first ring you will find the different advertisers, in the second ring the types of targeting used (location, language, ...). And finally, if you click on a ring, the graph will enlarge to show you the targeting values (Swiss, French, ...) in the outer ring.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  targetingType,
  targetingValue,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  TwitterCriterion
GROUP BY
  targetingType,
  targetingValue;

value.Follower look-alikes: Twitter determine users similar to those who follow accounts based on a variety of signals, including what they Retweet, click on, Tweet, and more.
value.Interests: Twitter determine interests based on a variety of signals, including who they follow, what they Retweet, click on, Tweet, and more.
value.App Activity: Reach groups of people who have taken a specific action in your app, such as installs or sign-ups.
value.Website Activity: It is possible to collect this data using Twitter's website tag available through Twitter Ads.
value.List: Lists are created by uploading a file containing your email address, mobile advertising ID or Twitter username.
value.Conversation topics: People may be considered part of a conversation audience if they've Tweeted or engaged with a Tweet mentioning the topic.
value.Keywords: Keyword targeting allows advertisers to reach people on Twitter based on keywords in their search queries, recent Tweets, and Tweets they recently engaged with.
value.Locations: Twitter’s geo targeting is based on someone's recent location. This is a combination of current location and recent location history. Twitter uses several signals for determining whether someone is presently in a particular geographic location, such as web IP address, mobile GPS signal, mobile WiFi signal, and real-time signals, such as when someone includes their location in a Tweet.
value.Age: If not specified in your Twitter profile, Twitter deduct it from users who did it, based on a number of attributes such as the accounts they follows and their interests.
value.Languages: Twitter derive a person’s language from the language selected in their profile settings, the languages that correspond to their activity on Twitter and more.
value.Gender: Twitter use the gender provided by people in their profiles, and extend that data to other people based on factors of account likeness to determine the gender of people haven't manually entered their preferred gender.
value.OS versions: Advertisers can target by Operating System (e.g IOS vs Android)
value.Platforms: Advertisers can target by platform used by the client (e.g Iphone 7 vs Iphone 8)
value.Events: With event targeting, Twitter can discover and target the events that best fit the advertisers' audience — then create a campaign that delivers their ads at just the right time to just the right audience as the event unfolds.

tooltip.signal: datum.targetingValue + " was used by " + datum.count_ + " advertiser(s)"

value.Follower look-alikes: Twitter détermine les utilisateurs similaires à ceux qui suivent des comptes sur la base d'une variété de signaux, notamment ce qu'ils retweetent, cliquent, tweetent, etc.
value.Interests: Twitter détermine les intérêts en fonction de divers signaux, notamment les personnes qu'elles suivent, ce qu'elles retweetent, ce qu'elles cliquent, ce qu'elles tweetent, etc
value.App Activity: Atteignez les groupes de personnes qui ont effectué une action spécifique dans votre application, comme des installations ou des inscriptions.
value.Website Activity: Il est possible de collecter ces données à l'aide de la balise de site web de Twitter disponible via Twitter Ads.
value.List: Les listes sont créées en téléchargeant un fichier contenant votre adresse e-mail, votre identifiant publicitaire mobile ou votre nom d'utilisateur Twitter.
value.Conversation topics: Les personnes peuvent être considérées comme faisant partie d'une audience de conversation si elles ont tweeté ou se sont engagées avec un tweet mentionnant le sujet.
value.Keywords: Le ciblage par mot-clé permet aux annonceurs d'atteindre des personnes sur Twitter sur la base de mots-clés dans leurs requêtes de recherche, de Tweets récents et de Tweets avec lesquels ils se sont récemment engagés.
value.Locations: Le ciblage géographique de Twitter est basé sur la localisation récente d'une personne. Il s'agit d'une combinaison de la localisation actuelle et de l'historique des localisations récentes. Twitter utilise plusieurs signaux pour déterminer si quelqu'un se trouve actuellement dans un lieu géographique particulier, comme l'adresse IP web, le signal GPS mobile, le signal WiFi mobile, et des signaux en temps réel, comme lorsque quelqu'un inclut son emplacement dans un Tweet.
value.Age: S'il n'est pas spécifié dans votre profil Twitter, Twitter le déduit des utilisateurs qui l'ont fait, en se basant sur un certain nombre d'attributs tels que les comptes qu'ils suivent et leurs intérêts
value.Languages: Twitter déduit la langue d'une personne à partir de la langue sélectionnée dans les paramètres de son profil, des langues qui correspondent à son activité sur Twitter et plus encore.
value.Gender: Twitter utilise le genre fourni par les personnes dans leurs profils, et étend ces données à d'autres personnes en fonction de facteurs de ressemblance de comptes pour déterminer le genre des personnes n'ayant pas saisi manuellement leur genre préféré.
value.OS versions: Les annonceurs peuvent cibler par système d'exploitation (par exemple, IOS vs Android)
value.Platforms: Les annonceurs peuvent cibler par plateforme utilisée par le client (par exemple Iphone 7 vs Iphone 8)
value.Events: Avec le ciblage par événement, Twitter peut découvrir et cibler les événements qui correspondent le mieux à l'audience des annonceurs - puis créer une campagne qui diffuse leurs publicités au bon moment, à la bonne audience, au fur et à mesure que l'événement se déroule.

tooltip.signal: datum.targetingValue + " a été utilisé " + datum.count_ + " annonceur(s)"

viewBlocks.title: Targeting criteria (All advertisers)
viewBlocks.text: Get more details on how you are targeted by these advertisers. This graph shows the number of times you have been targeted by different advertisers using a specific criterion. You can change the type of criterion and get information about the meaning of each criterion's type at the bottom of the graph.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  advertiserName,
  targetingType,
  targetingValue,
  COUNT(*) AS count_
FROM
  TwitterAd
  INNER JOIN TwitterCriterion ON TwitterAd.id = TwitterCriterion.adId
GROUP BY
  advertiserName,
  targetingType,
  targetingValue;
viewBlocks.title: Targeting criteria (1 advertiser)
viewBlocks.text: Visualize the targeting criteria used by one specific advertiser. You can look up the advertiser in the table below and click on it to visualise them.

viewBlocks.sql:
SELECT
  *
FROM
  TwitterPersonalization;
viewBlocks.title: Inferred Data
viewBlocks.text: Find out what information Twitter has deduced about you

viewBlocks.title: Timeline
viewBlocks.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.

tripsData.title: Uber overview
tripsData.text: This interactive visualisation shows your Uber habits, play with it to discover everything Uber knows on you. Your data is grouped by currency and every graph is filterable.

messages.select-currency: Select data depending on the currency

tripsGraphData.title: Uber Trips
tripsGraphData.text: Get information about the places you have visited the most or from which you originate the most.
tripsGraphData.labelTotal: In total there are {total} records of trips you have made with Uber

genericDateViewer.name: Timeline
genericDateViewer.title: Timeline
genericDateViewer.text: See all the dated events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific date.
genericDateViewer.graphTitle: Number of dated events in your files
genericDateViewer.graphNoDate: No dated events were found in your file(s).
genericDateViewer.datedEvents: From {currMinDate} to {currMaxDate} we found {total} dated events in your file(s).

genericLocationViewer.name: Location Observations
genericLocationViewer.title: Location Observations
genericLocationViewer.text: See all the location events in your files, corresponding to data that has been collected on you at or concerning a specific location.
genericLocationViewer.graphTitle: Number of location records in your files
genericLocationViewer.graphNoLocation: No location were found in your file(s).
genericLocationViewer.locations: We found {total} locations in your file(s).

tripsData.title: Vue d'ensemble
tripsData.text: Visualisation interactive de vos habitudes sur Uber. Les données se regroupent par devise, et l'on peut ajouter des filtres sur les graphiques.

messages.select-currency: Sélectionner les données selon la devise

tripsGraphData.title: Trajets
tripsGraphData.text: Informations sur vos destinations et points de départ.
tripsGraphData.labelTotal: Au total, il y a {total} enregistrements des voyages que vous avez effectués avec Uber

genericDateViewer.name: Chronologie
genericDateViewer.title: Chronologie
genericDateViewer.text: Voir tous les événements datés dans vos dossiers, correspondant aux données qui ont été collectées sur vous à ou concernant une date spécifique.
genericDateViewer.graphTitle: Nombre d'événements datés dans vos dossiers
genericDateViewer.graphNoDate: Aucun événement daté n'a été trouvé dans votre (vos) dossier(s).
genericDateViewer.datedEvents: De {currMinDate} à {currMaxDate} nous avons trouvé {total} événements datés dans votre (vos) fichier(s).

genericLocationViewer.name: Positions
genericLocationViewer.title: Observations de localisation
genericLocationViewer.text: Voir tous les événements de localisation dans vos fichiers, correspondant aux données qui ont été collectées sur vous à ou concernant un lieu spécifique.
genericLocationViewer.graphTitle: Nombre de localisation dans vos fichiers
genericLocationViewer.graphNoLocation: Aucune localisation n'a été trouvé dans votre/vos fichier(s).
genericLocationViewer.locations: Nous avons trouvé {total} observations de localisation dans votre/vos fichier(s).
